page.title: 06Manor of Spaunton Court Leet
page.content: The{Court Leet}is held annually at 11.00 in the forenoon on the first Thursday in October. 14 common right owners are summoned & a foreman is chosen,they then swear allegience to the Monarch. Their duties are to 'police'the land & report any offence. An encroachment onto common land is subject to a fine which is collected by the Baliff. In recent years some land has been enclosed by commoners who pay a minimal for this privilage, & they have to maintain all boundary fences. At a public enquiry some years ago several commoners had some of their rights removed. A few farmers now rent extra grazing rights. Although the Court Leet owes it's history to tradition,it's laws & customs play a useful part in comunity life today.
